subclusters.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Systemic Aging Theory
p53 Isoform Regulation of Cellular Senescence Theory
Autophagy Decline and Cellular Senescence Prevention Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Systemic Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescent cell accumulation, SASP secretion, and systemic aging effects including inflammation and multimorbidity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Systemic Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescent cell accumulation, SASP-driven chronic inflammation, and causal role in organismal aging and diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Systemic Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes SASP-driven chronic inflammation and tissue dysfunction caused by senescent cells accumulating with age.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Systemic Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescent cell accumulation, SASP secretion, and their causal role in cardiovascular aging and systemic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Systemic Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links cellular senescence gene expression changes and senescent cell accumulation to chronic lung diseases and systemic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Systemic Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes radiation-induced endothelial senescence, SASP-driven neurovascular inflammation, and cerebromicrovascular aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Systemic Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses heterogeneity of senescent cells, immune senescence, stem cell senescence, and systemic aging effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Systemic Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes senescence as a longevity assurance mechanism linked to DNA damage response and tissue integrity maintenance.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Systemic Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Models cellular senescence as homeostasis imbalance with SASP as a key driver of chronic inflammation and aging pathology.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Systemic Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes dual role of senescence in cancer and aging, emphasizing SASP effects on tumor microenvironment and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Systemic Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescence as tumor suppression and SASP-mediated paracrine effects influencing cancer and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) and Systemic Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Covers replicative and stress-induced senescence, tumor suppression, and SASP-driven tumor promotion and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: p53 Isoform Regulation of Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on regulation of senescence by p53 isoforms in T cells, linking molecular isoform switching to immunosenescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: p53 Isoform Regulation of Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes ATM/p53 pathway activation by oncogene-induced DNA damage leading to senescence as tumor suppression.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: p53 Isoform Regulation of Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Integrates stress signals via p53 and Rb pathways to induce senescence as a general cellular stress response.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: p53 Isoform Regulation of Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links nuclear envelope abnormalities and p16/p21 cell cycle dysregulation to premature senescence in progeroid myotonic dystrophy.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: p53 Isoform Regulation of Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes microglia senescence driven by intrinsic and extrinsic factors, impairing neuroprotection and promoting neurodegeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: p53 Isoform Regulation of Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details DICER1 regulation of microRNA biogenesis affecting senescence pathways, involving AMPK and p53-related stress responses.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere-Associated Replicative Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on telomere shortening as a biological clock limiting replicative capacity and driving replicative senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere-Associated Replicative Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes evolutionary tradeoff in telomere length balancing cancer risk and degenerative disease risk.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere-Associated Replicative Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links hematopoietic stem cell replicative limits and telomere attrition to intrinsic aging and lifespan scaling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Telomere-Associated Replicative Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes telomere shortening and oxidative stress driving senescence in bone cells, impairing bone regeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autophagy Decline and Cellular Senescence Prevention Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes age-related autophagy decline causing accumulation of damaged components and promoting cellular senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autophagy Decline and Cellular Senescence Prevention Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on autophagy as cellular housekeeping whose decline accelerates aging and senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autophagy Decline and Cellular Senescence Prevention Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details lysosomal dysfunction and hormonal regulation impairing autophagy, contributing to aging and senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autophagy Decline and Cellular Senescence Prevention Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Genetic evidence links autophagy decline causally to aging phenotypes and reduced lifespan.
